required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Susceptibility Genes and Pathogenic Mechanism of Non-syndromic Familial Aortic Dissection
clinical_study.official_title: Study on Susceptibility Genes and Pathogenic Mechanism of Non-syndromic Familial Aortic Dissection

brief_summary.textblock: Aortic dissection is dangerous and difficult to predict, so it is particularly important to carry out early prevention, diagnosis and rational treatment for high-risk groups. The related genes found in previous studies can not be detected in all patients with dissection; at present, the pathogenesis of non-syndromic aortic dissection is not clear, of which about 20% of patients have family aggregation and have the general representative characteristics of non-syndromic dissection. In this project, the peripheral blood samples of core family subjects were detected by sequencing technique. analyze disease-related susceptibility genes; 2 determine the effect of susceptibility genes on the incidence of dissection in mice through animal experiments; and 3 explore the effect of susceptibility genes on cell function at the cellular level.

primary_outcome.description: Discovery of known or unknown genes

clinical_study.condition: Aortic Dissection, Familial, With or Without Aortic Aneurysm

intervention.description: aortic dissection or aneurysm patients this is an observation cohort study about a Non-syndromic Familial Aortic Dissection without intervention.

biospec_descr.textblock: DNA is extracted from blood and preserved for a long time.

study_pop.textblock: 1, family members have no traumatic aortic dissection; 2, no pregnancy or tumor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Family inclusion criteria: 1 at least one person in each generation of a family has aortic dissection, and at least two generations of members can be included;
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pedigree exclusion criteria: pedigree members have marfan syndrome, Loeys-Dietz syndrome, Ehler-Danlos syndrome, aneurysm-Osteoarthritis syndrome and other syndroms
